title: The March 2025 EVE Online Monthly Economic Report
description: The Monthly Economic Report for March landed earlier this week, so it is time for a quick peek at that.   As previously noted, I changed the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so you can now find it in the drop down on the side bar if you’re just dying to have […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: The Monthly Economic Report for March landed earlier this week, so it is time for a quick peek at that. As previously noted, I changed the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so y…
text: The Monthly Economic Report for March landed earlier this week, so it is time for a quick peek at that. EVE Online nerds harder As previously noted, I changed the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so you can now find it in the drop down on the side bar if you’re just dying to have some MER porn on demand. And, as always, others write a lot about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking. CCP – March 2025 Monthly Economic Report CCP – March 2025 MER Forum Thread Reddit – March 2025 MER Thread TNG – March 2025 Activity In EVE Online TNG – A Look At The March 2025 Active ISK Delta CCP Highlights CCP’s take away from the March MER: Production has stabilized and we’ve seen a marked increase in Mining, especially in Null Sec. The Bounty Faucet also saw a dip in March, while Market Tax Sinks have increased. March saw an update which, among other things, introduced tier 3 mining anomalies to null sec, accompanied by a ratting nerf, all to try to get more people to mine and maybe, finally alleviate the mineral shortage that has plagued the game for nearly four years, since the introduction of the economic austerity plan, which flirted with the idea of seeing how CCP could keep players from undocking or even logging in.  (Once again, summarized in my year of disappointment post.) So did it work?  Well, the mineral price index did come down from its all time high finally. March 2025 – Economic Indices since 2018 The MPI is still higher than any past peak, even if we stretch back beyond 2018. February 2025 – Economic Indices for All Time But it isn’t continuing to climb and has come down some… and that was with less than half a month with the update in place.  So the trend should continue downward. You can also see the uptick in the asteroid mining chart. March 2025 – Asteroid Mining over Time The big increase was in null sec.  There were some people unhappy about the patch because they felt it was “stealing” mining from other areas of space… but high sec seemed unaffected, while low sec, which CCP was trying to make a thing when it came to mining, continued to insist that mining was never going to be a thing in that gank-fest security band. Meanwhile, NPCs bounties were down with the nerf while transaction taxes rose with the tax hike because most everybody goes to Jita to buy things. March 2025 – Sinks and Faucets over time So it goes.  There was still a net increase in ISK in the game, but perhaps not as much as there could have been. 2025 Destruction Summary March also saw an uptick in total losses, loss value, and losses per day. Loss Count Total January – 514,511 total losses February – 427,027 total losses March – 538,625 total losses Avg Losses per Day January – 16,597.13 losses per day February – 15,250.96 losses per day March – 17,375.00 losses per day Total ISK Value Lost January – 46.86 trillion ISK February – 44.55 trillion ISK March – 50.78 trillion ISK Total ISK Value Lost per Day January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day March – 1,638.07 billion ISK per day Uitra Watch March also saw CCP nerf/fix the AIR Career Program.   I have a post that goes into the details of the change, but the incentive system to keep running an infinite number of fresh alts through the program has been removed. This, however, came at the end of the month, so we won’t see the real effect in the numbers with the March data.  But next month… that should be interesting. Here are the loss counts so far for 2025: January Total – 42,984 Shuttles – 28,675 Corvettes – 13,828 February Total – 36,495 Shuttles – 18,364 Corvettes – 17,658 March Total – 32,392 Shuttles – 18,187 Corvettes – 13,774 The March numbers are down a bit.  Out of 58,063 shuttles lost in March, 56% of them were lost in Uitra.  I expect that will be very different in April.   Meanwhile the daily loss count for the system tells the tale the best.  Here are the last 11 days of March in Uitra: Date Ship  Loss Count  21st Shuttle        1,106 22nd Shuttle            715 23rd Shuttle            776 24th Shuttle            729 25th Shuttle            489 26th Shuttle            362 27th Shuttle              15 28th Shuttle              13 29th Shuttle                5 30th Shuttle              18 31st Shuttle              28 The patch landed on the 26th and by the 27th the word was out and shuttle losses were way down. Now, did it affect the bigger picture, the overall losses per day?  Maybe? March 2025 – Losses Per Day Certainly ISK wouldn’t have been impacted… but the overall count by day… well, that will probably show up better in April when compared to past months. So looking at that in April and then again in May probably… after which my Uitra crusade will likely be at an end.  Then what?  Back to hulls lost only once?  We’ll see.
html:
The Monthly Economic Report for March landed earlier this week, so it is time for a quick peek at that.

EVE Online nerds harder

As previously noted, I changed the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so you can now find it in the drop down on the side bar if you’re just dying to have some MER porn on demand.

And, as always, others write a lot about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking.

  • CCP – March 2025 Monthly Economic Report
  • CCP – March 2025 MER Forum Thread
  • Reddit – March 2025 MER Thread
  • TNG – March 2025 Activity In EVE Online
  • TNG – A Look At The March 2025 Active ISK Delta

CCP Highlights

CCP’s take away from the March MER:

  • Production has stabilized and we’ve seen a marked increase in Mining, especially in Null Sec.
  • The Bounty Faucet also saw a dip in March, while Market Tax Sinks have increased.

March saw an update which, among other things, introduced tier 3 mining anomalies to null sec, accompanied by a ratting nerf, all to try to get more people to mine and maybe, finally alleviate the mineral shortage that has plagued the game for nearly four years, since the introduction of the economic austerity plan, which flirted with the idea of seeing how CCP could keep players from undocking or even logging in.  (Once again, summarized in my year of disappointment post.)

So did it work?  Well, the mineral price index did come down from its all time high finally.

March 2025 – Economic Indices since 2018

The MPI is still higher than any past peak, even if we stretch back beyond 2018.

February 2025 – Economic Indices for All Time

But it isn’t continuing to climb and has come down some… and that was with less than half a month with the update in place.  So the trend should continue downward.

You can also see the uptick in the asteroid mining chart.

March 2025 – Asteroid Mining over Time

The big increase was in null sec.  There were some people unhappy about the patch because they felt it was “stealing” mining from other areas of space… but high sec seemed unaffected, while low sec, which CCP was trying to make a thing when it came to mining, continued to insist that mining was never going to be a thing in that gank-fest security band.

Meanwhile, NPCs bounties were down with the nerf while transaction taxes rose with the tax hike because most everybody goes to Jita to buy things.

March 2025 – Sinks and Faucets over time

So it goes.  There was still a net increase in ISK in the game, but perhaps not as much as there could have been.

2025 Destruction Summary

March also saw an uptick in total losses, loss value, and losses per day.

  • Loss Count Total
    • January – 514,511 total losses
    • February – 427,027 total losses
    • March – 538,625 total losses
  • Avg Losses per Day
    • January – 16,597.13 losses per day
    • February – 15,250.96 losses per day
    • March – 17,375.00 losses per day
  • Total ISK Value Lost
    • January – 46.86 trillion ISK
    • February – 44.55 trillion ISK
    • March – 50.78 trillion ISK
  • Total ISK Value Lost per Day
    • January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day
    • February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day
    • March – 1,638.07 billion ISK per day

Uitra Watch

March also saw CCP nerf/fix the AIR Career Program.   I have a post that goes into the details of the change, but the incentive system to keep running an infinite number of fresh alts through the program has been removed.

This, however, came at the end of the month, so we won’t see the real effect in the numbers with the March data.  But next month… that should be interesting.

Here are the loss counts so far for 2025:

  • January
    • Total – 42,984
    • Shuttles – 28,675
    • Corvettes – 13,828
  • February
    • Total – 36,495
    • Shuttles – 18,364
    • Corvettes – 17,658
  • March
    • Total – 32,392
    • Shuttles – 18,187
    • Corvettes – 13,774

The March numbers are down a bit.  Out of 58,063 shuttles lost in March, 56% of them were lost in Uitra.  I expect that will be very different in April.   Meanwhile the daily loss count for the system tells the tale the best.  Here are the last 11 days of March in Uitra:

Date Ship  Loss Count 
21st Shuttle        1,106
22nd Shuttle            715
23rd Shuttle            776
24th Shuttle            729
25th Shuttle            489
26th Shuttle            362
27th Shuttle              15
28th Shuttle              13
29th Shuttle                5
30th Shuttle              18
31st Shuttle              28

The patch landed on the 26th and by the 27th the word was out and shuttle losses were way down.

Now, did it affect the bigger picture, the overall losses per day?  Maybe?

March 2025 – Losses Per Day

Certainly ISK wouldn’t have been impacted… but the overall count by day… well, that will probably show up better in April when compared to past months.

So looking at that in April and then again in May probably… after which my Uitra crusade will likely be at an end.  Then what?  Back to hulls lost only once?  We’ll see.
